title: suggestion: lay out book
content:
Hello,  
i'am bulding a magazine for my graduation project. i examined variety of grid & typography books, and i'm really happy with that. i'think it's time to look at lay-out books. to learn and remember the basics and advance theories about designing layouts.

so i need some suggestions here. what is your favorite book about ,or relative, designing layouts; for magazines, books or anaything upon a grid.

and thank you for intrest.

Here are a couple of mine:

_[Making and Breaking the Grid: A Graphic Design Layout Workshop](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015102644/http:/www.amazon.com/Making-Breaking-Grid-Graphic-Workshop/dp/1592531253/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1269306078&sr=1-3)_, by Timothy Samara

_[Layout Essentials: 100 Design Principles for Using Grids](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015102644/http:/www.amazon.com/Layout-Essentials-Design-Principles-Using/dp/1592534724/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1269306078&sr=1-1)_, by Beth Tondreau

Few months ago I wrote two articles on my blog about how to make a grid in Illustrator. Maybe not what you are looking for, but there are several links there that you might find helpful.
